definition: joss paper made to resemble paper money
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: But some people find smoke from burning incense paper a nuisance.
sentences.chinese: 因爲燒冥紙產生的煙霧使許多人不堪其憂。

sentences.english: The Story started from Aunt Sam who burned the joss papers(money for the dead)in alane of Tung Pin Chau.
sentences.chinese: 故事由西坪洲冷巷裏焚冥紙的三婆啓初。

sentences.english: Paper is prepared for our "Good Brothers".
sentences.chinese: 這整堆的冥紙是爲好兄弟而準備的。

sentences.english: Burning paper ghost money really pollutes the air and could start dangerous fires.
sentences.chinese: 燃燒冥紙其實很污染空氣，而且有引起火災之虞。

definition: to frame sb/to cook up imaginary charges against sb
to spin a web (spider)/to weave a net (e.g. for fishing)
fuse (for an explosive device)/electrical lead/intermediary/catalyst/(dialect) sewing needle
fire and candles/household things that burn
to wash one's hands/(fig.) to go to the toilet
